pkgsnip 0.0.9026
  • Reference

Commonly used abbreviations in R code

Source: R/pkgsnip.gen.R
abbreviations.Rd

Returns a tibble listing an opinionated set of abbreviations commonly used when writing R code. It can be used as a reference, for example, to check availability when considering using some abbreviation in a function or argument name.

abbreviations(expand = FALSE)

abbrs(expand = FALSE)

Arguments

expand

Whether to expand the full_expression column and return the data in long format. If FALSE, a "nested" list column full_expressions will be returned, meaning the values in column abbreviation will be unique.

Value

A tibble.

Examples

pkgsnip::abbrs(expand = TRUE) |> print(n = Inf)

#> # A tibble: 138 × 2
